Rep: Jerrold Nadler did not oppose releasing any details from the Starr report to Congress or the public.
Independent counsel Kenneth Starr turned: page report and supporting materials to the House of Representatives in 1998.
Nadler acknowledged that certain portion: such as grand jury testimony, needed to be kept secret by law.
Nadler advocated for Congress to review: and he supported giving President Clinton the opportunity to see the report and prepare a response before any public release.
